Monthly Archives: March 2014

Karen Millen

Josephine Leung | March 29, 2014
A responsive redesign of the Karen Millen ecommerce website that focuses on beautiful inspirational imagery and fashion editorial contents. The fluid desktop to tablet to mobile design enables every KM woman to enjoy a clean and informative customer journey that ended on the products, which are expertly hand crafted in house.
Categories: work-entry Tags: Web Design

Made.com

Josephine Leung | March 29, 2014
Magazine insert concept design for MADE.COM. Key objectives of the project is to introduce MADE.COM to new customers and communicate the core benefits and their unique business model in a fresh and surprising way. I will also need to showcase what kind of products they offer and explain how unique they are whilst making the […]

Josephine Leung | March 29, 2014
M&S poured Â£150m into its new e-commerce site which was successfully launched in Feburary 2014. I was the lead designer on this redesign project which lasted over a year. The new website has repositioned M&S as a trend-led fashion shopping site that inspires customers with outfitting ideas and carefully curated editorial contents. The adaptive website […]

ZUMMA

Josephine Leung | March 29, 2014

Can You ‘Ear Me?

Josephine Leung | March 29, 2014
Co-founded online ecommerce website Can You Ear Me? Which supports emerging designers of fashion, jewellery and accessories and also independent fashion labels. The website is built in Prestashop and all the photography is shot in-house.
